--- title: "Day 2B Practice" format: html: df-print: paged --- ![](../img/making_art_2780E3.svg){.hero} ::: {.cell} ::: ## Question 1 For each of the following code snippets, find and fix the error(s). a) "The Scatterbrained Scatterplot" ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(mpg, x = displ, y = hwy) + geom_point() ``` ::: b) "Not-so-smooth Smoothing" ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + geom_point() geom_smooth() + scale_y_continuous("Highway MPG") + scale_x_discrete("Engine Size") ``` ::: c) "A Leaky Pipeline" ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(economics, aes(x = date, y = unemploy)) |> geom_line() |> geom_point() ``` :::

Click here for the answer key
**Answer (a)** The code forgot to put the mappings inside `aes()`. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + # fix 1 geom_point() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: **Answer (b)** The code forgot a `+` and set the x-axis to discrete instead of continuous. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + geom_point() + # fix 1 geom_smooth() + scale_y_continuous("Highway MPG") + scale_x_continuous("Engine Size") # fix 2 #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula 'y ~ x' ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: **Answer (c)** The code used pipes instead of plus signs to connect ggplot2 commands. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(economics, aes(x = date, y = unemploy)) + # fix 1 geom_line() + # fix 2 geom_point() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672} ::: :::

## Question 2 a) Install and load the \{palmerpenguins\} package. b) Recreate the following graphic as closely as you can from the `penguins` tibble in that package (don't worry about getting the geom settings exactly right). c) Clean up the x and y axis titles so that they are more readable (e.g., "Flipper length (mm)" instead of "flipper_length_mm"). *Bonus:* See if you can figure out how to also rename the legend title. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672} ::: :::

Click here for the answer key
**Answer (a)** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Extra pane > Packages tab > Install button > palmerpenguins > Install library(palmerpenguins) ``` ::: **Answer (b)** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = bill_length_mm, color = species, shape = species)) + geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.75) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: **Answer (c)** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} p <- ggplot(penguins, aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = bill_length_mm, color = species, shape = species)) + geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.75) + scale_x_continuous(name = "Flipper length (mm)") + scale_y_continuous(name = "Body mass (g)") + scale_color_discrete(name = "Penguin species") + scale_shape_discrete(name = "Penguin species") p ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672} ::: :::

## Question 3 a) Use your graphic from Question 2(c) a starting graphic object. Apply the "classic" complete theme to it and move the legend to the top. *Bonus:* Also make the axis titles italic (you may need to check a cheatsheet or do some searching to find the right element). b) Export this graphic as an image file to include in a paper. Make it 6.5 inches wide and 4 inches high. *Bonus:* Open Microsoft Word or Google Docs and insert the image.

Click here for the answer key
**Answer (a)** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} p2 <- p + theme_classic() + theme( legend.position = "top", axis.title = element_text(face = "italic") # bonus ) p2 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: **Answer (b)** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggsave("practice.png", plot = p2, width = 6.5, height = 4, units = "in") ``` :::
